means: 庆祝，庆贺（“celebrate“的过去式和过去分词）
主持宗教仪式（尤指圣餐）

sentence.Network_en: Pope John Paul celebrated mass today in a city in central Poland.
sentence.Network_cn: 教皇保罗二世今天在波兰中部的一个城市主持了弥撒。

sentence.Network_en: He was soon one of the most celebrated young painters in England.
sentence.Network_cn: 不久他就成了英格兰最负盛名的年轻画家之一。

sentence.Network_en: He and Helen celebrated their silver wedding last year.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和海伦去年庆祝了他们的银婚。

C开头的单词_百度文库 ... ceiling n. 天花板，顶蓬 celebrate vt. 庆祝；歌颂，赞美 cell n. 细胞；小房间.

entry.tran: 著名的;有名的；受人敬仰的
entry.def: A celebrated person or thing is famous and much admired.

example.ex: He was soon one of the most celebrated young painters in England...
example.tran: 不久他就成了英格兰最负盛名的年轻画家之一。

example.ex: Dean died three days before the opening of Rebel Without Cause, his most celebrated film.
example.tran: 迪恩在他最知名的电影《无因的反叛》首映的3天之前去世。

auth_sentence.content: Following the release of his celebrated Nude Dimensions Vol.
auth_sentence.res_content: Following the release of his celebrated Nude Dimensions Vol.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Following the release of his celebrated Nude Dimensions Vol.

auth_sentence.content: No one has celebrated BP's safety record since.
auth_sentence.res_content: No one has celebrated BP's safety record since.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No one has celebrated BP's safety record since.

auth_sentence.content: While some celebrated, others pondered their next move.
auth_sentence.res_content: While some celebrated, others pondered their next move.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: While some celebrated, others pondered their next move.

Sentence.sentence: Just over a decade into the 21st century, women's progress can be celebrated across a range of fields.

sentences.en: Three celebrated tenors sang at the president’s inauguration.
sentences.cn: 3位著名的男高音歌手在总统就职仪式上演唱。

sentences.en: Venice is celebrated for its beautiful buildings.
sentences.cn: 威尼斯以美丽的建筑而闻名。

sentences.en: He has become celebrated as an artist.
sentences.cn: 他已成为大名鼎鼎的艺术家了。
